page.title: 01STOURPORT ON SEVERN
page.content: Written and archaeological evidence of human settlement at{Burlish,Areley {Kings,Mitton,Titton and Wilden}exist from the Domesday Book of 1086.The community of Stourport was truly created by an{Act of Parliament}of 1766.With the coming of the canals supervised by{James Brindley,Stourport grew rapidly creating it's own industry allied to the newly created transport system. More recent growth has seen the development of a residential and {tourist centre,}being favoured as an inland water resort boasting rivers, canals,marinas,basins,historic buildings and a museum.Also adding to the amenities are{Hartlebury Common, self picking fruit farms,numerous sporting and leisure facilities as well as being a choice centre for {carnivals,regattas,etc.
